website_summaries.verdict: A slow-to-heat appliance that will accommodate larger loads.
cons: Average wattage (1,350) has drawn some complaints
Some issues with achieving and maintaining sufficient steam

customer_reviews.title: Press On!
customer_reviews.text: This press was exactly what I wanted. I had ordered a shaker version and returned it. It was just too small. This however is huge. Mashed pressing and starching my jeans and shirts a breeze! It's electronic so setting it is so easy. I also really like the steam feature. If you do a lot of ironing, or perhaps like me you don't want to spend hours ironing, this is for you! I'm a pressing fool now, everything gets the treatment. From my wife's scrubs to my t-shirts, ha! I recommend this item, sure it's a little pricy, but in a firm believer inn you get what you pay for. Press on, people, press on!
customer_reviews.author: 101st Airborne Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Described
customer_reviews.text: It came with a water holder that was not glued properly and it leaked. I repaired it with epoxy and the press works just fine. The water holder defect seems to be a problem with most of these, based on other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's nice. Not sure if it would replace an iron
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. Not sure if it would replace an iron, but first use went well. Slightly awkward to iron shirts...had to think what to do first for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well but man it gets HOT and if you have any kids running around you must be mindful where you have it set up and you have to make sure you have it on it own circut but it is a nice product just make sure you really need something like this
customer_reviews.author: smittyka

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this brand
customer_reviews.text: The bottom where you lay your garment has two strips of metal screwed on the plate. which are not flat. Because they are raised when you close cover to press you ruin all your clothes with long marks of where these metal strips are. I would not recommend this brand. I had a simplicity model which was great but no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent press I love it makes my clothes look like they came from the cleaners very impressed thx.
customer_reviews.author: felix wooden

customer_reviews.title: it works when it works....lol
customer_reviews.text: awesome when it worked...used it 3 times very good but I think it overheated and no power....will return for another one.....
customer_reviews.author: Vinson chatman

customer_reviews.title: LOST HEAT WITHIN 2 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS- ONE OF THE MOST EXPENSIVE PRESSES ON MARKET. MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE DROPPED 100 DEGREES WITHIN 2 MONTHS. NOT PLEASED WHATSOEVER
customer_reviews.author: Tibor Rudas

customer_reviews.title: Water tank defective.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first one on the first try the water tank was licking. I thought it was broken. I returned it and got a new one. Second use it's licking again. I checked and found out the water holder was not properly glued.
customer_reviews.author: Mireille T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: What a great iron board. Works wonderfully, steams well, and is large enough to press shirts, shorts, etc. One problem is that it does not open wide enough. Burn my knuckles if I a not careful. Guess this is something I'll get use to. Would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lars1y

customer_reviews.title: Great for ironing table cloths
customer_reviews.text: We iron more than 100 table cloths every week, and this iron press definitely does the job. We would struggle so much and would never finish ironing all our cloths, but ever since we got this iron press we can iron everything in 1 or 2 days ! When it first came in after 2 weeks it started having problems with smoke coming out of it, but we called and it was replaced immediately and we are very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: Product only lasted 6 weeks the Heating element stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try not to burn yourself..lol
customer_reviews.text: Like that it presses the jeans very good. Pressing clothes
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: I like this product a whole lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a whole lot. However, I recently purchased it and I'm still learning how to use it. Once I master this, it will be very helpful with my steam and press work.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda E. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer to use for our Marching Band uniforms. We have a band of 230 kids and I was thrilled with the performance of this product. I wish we had spent the money on it 3 years ago. It was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: diane brose

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t press evenly.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good way to save money on dry cleaning bill. Just doesn’t work very well.
customer_reviews.author: mark hutcheson

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very large surface. Does a great job and much nicer press than regular iron. Takes a little long to heat up to "steaming" temp (as compared to my previous Steamfast press). Not much space between pressing surface and handle for for large item so be careful not to burn arm/hand. Would buy again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Seems great so far, with one hiccup.
customer_reviews.text: When I receive this press, instead of pumping steam, it pumped water into itself and then out of the bottom onto the table it was sitting on. Electrically scary! Thankfully, Amazon replaced it QUICKLY and effortlessly. What a pleasant experience! I submitted my request for replacement online, and within a couple of days the deliveryman was at my door with a replacement and a return shipping label. Very easy! I also contacted the manufacturer and they called me cack the next day. Nice to know that if Amazon hadn't been there, they would have.
customer_reviews.author: Shamus

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this machine
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this machine !!! I was hesitant to purchase, because of the price and some of the reviews. But I'm so glad I did. I'm a seamstress and always have the iron on for bits and pieces while I'm working. It does shut off fast, and does take a bit to warm back up. But I just have everything ready, and I can whip through it in nothing flat. Definitely a time saving.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Forget about pressing shirts with this device!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sienna Empressa SSP-3208 In hopes to save money on my dry cleaning. This press does a horrible job at pressing shirts. I would literally have to iron my shirts after pressing them with this press. It creates more work than using a regular iron. The shirts are never smoothly pressed. I don’t use it anymore, it’s just taking up space now
customer_reviews.author: Kennard M.

customer_reviews.title: Dad loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dad loves it. Wish but came with it's own legs like a traditional ironing board. But it's working good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Trendi

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: dont waist money on this product. Its not for home users and it does not iron!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. It's warming up right now. Only drawback I didn't anticipate is you really have to make sure the article of clothing is straight or it will come out crinkled. Saves time...but not as much as I'd hoped for. Might be user error....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not live up to expectations
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a month (5-6 uses) but now doesn't steam at all. Very sad about the money I spent on this awful product.
customer_reviews.author: Jarvis2grd

customer_reviews.title: hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last year, used it less than a dozen times, and now it sits in the closet. Thought I could iron mens dress shirts easily with this, but it was very difficult and spend double the time it did with a regular iron.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This steam press works as advertised. I did by some protective gloves to keep from burning my hands, but it is the steam heat that makes it so effective.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product - so far.
customer_reviews.text: I would like this press panels to be longer but, so far it works just fine. Longevity will be key to my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for fusible fleece
customer_reviews.text: This press almost instantly adheres fusible fleece and interfacing to cotton fabrics. It does take a while to heat up, but then it's so much quicker than ironing one small spot at a time.
customer_reviews.author: MaineSue

customer_reviews.title: It will break!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine and it failed within a year. Company replaced but the replacement failed as well. When I informed them that the replacement had failed they told me the warranty only applied to the original. Bad machine, even worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C. Propst

product_meta.title: Sienna Empressa SSP-3208 Digital Steam Press, 1350 Watts, Extra Large Steam Press, 34”x12” Pressing Area
product_meta.description: Style Name:SSP-3208The Empressa Digital Steam Press is the perfect choice for those looking for a quick and easy to use alternative to conventional ironing. With an impressive pressing area, 10 times the size of an iron, The Empressa Digital Steam Press will quickly eliminate wrinkles and put a crease into the toughest fabrics.
feature_bullets: 10 times the size of a traditional ironing surface
Temperature range: 212 degrees F - 410 degrees F
Computer controlled LED Digital display for temperature accuracy
Safe on nylon, silk, wool, cotton, and linen.The steam press is easy to use. Just pull the handle down and press the button for a burst of steam
Non-Stick Pressing plate with Over 100 lbs. of even pressure to create sharp, long lasting creases
Includes accessory package: spray bottle, pressing cushion, and water fill cup.The steam press is easy to use. Just pull the handle down and press the button for a burst of steam

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.7 out of 5 stars46 ratings2.7 out of 5 stars
